posts.name: Joshua J
posts.cooked:
The status light on the RIO should only be on during boot; once it’s through the bootloader, it only turns on to indicate an issue. The radio light should never be on, it was designed for a feature that went unused.

The light pattern you’re seeing is normal and expected.

posts.name: N Miller (Mechanic/Electrician)
posts.cooked:
I’m not sure if this will help but;

My team had an issue with our radio as well earlier this week. We had it where individually, everything that we plugged our computer into would work and show up as responding (rio, DS radio, Robot radio) but nothing would connect all together. (I’m looking at this from a mechnic angle so it may not help much with the configuring and programmer/computer aspect.) We had to push an update to all of our REV hardware (including the PDH which needed to be updated so that it showed up on the can signal).

When testing out the radios, we found out that unfortuantely one of our radios’ (we have two to complete the competition-like setup) RIO port was able to transmit power but not ethernet. Check the physical connectivtiy between your radio and your rio and/or your radio and your DS . The issue we found was found purely by mistake as it was invisible elsewhere. Make sure, if you are using two radios, that one is labeled as the DS radio and the other as the robot radio. We ran into that issue where our programmer had to go back and check the adress to the radios to make sure the pushed signal was directed to the correct place. Additionally check that your signal will be send to the correct Rio adress (we checked our SD card).

If you are not using a RPM and are having trouble with the radio connecting to the rio, try putting power directly to the radio and then using one of the AUX ports? In theory the aux port should be able to send and recieve a ethernet signal. To my knowledge, the reason the RIO port on the radio is labeled as such is because it can do POE.

posts.name: mjbergman92
posts.cooked:
thatnameistaken:

The status light on the RIO should only be on during boot; once it’s through the bootloader, it only turns on to indicate an issue.

I had to re-figure this out as well. I had to go looking this up earlier this season to refresh myself.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked:
DukeEmree:

radio light still of.

The Radio light on the roboRIO is unused, it will always be off.
